title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
content: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

title: T20 World Cup: India vs Pakistan likely to go ahead after ICC, PCB talks
content: It is also learnt that Imran Khawaja and Mubashir Usmani, two ICC representatives, reached Lahore on Sunday morning.

title: 'Is snatching your child's phone a crime?' Father of 3 minors opens up about Ghaziabad suicide
content: Three minor sisters died by suicide in Ghaziabad. Their father confiscated their phones due to their obsession with Korean dramas and games. The girls were reportedly depressed after losing access to online activities and friends. Authorities are investigating the tragic incident. The father expressed his grief and confusion over the events.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink entry in Pakistan delayed over data security concerns
content: Starlink, owned by tech billionaire Elon Musk, is among five companies seeking approval to provide satellite-based internet services in Pakistan. However, officials say unresolved security considerations and broader geopolitical factors have slowed the clearance process. The report also cited the fallout between US President Donald Trump and Elon Musk as a factor being weighed by the Pakistani establishment.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: ‚ÄòNaxalism will be completely eradicated by March 31‚Äô: Shah after Raipur security review
content: Union home minister Amit Shah declared Naxalism will be eradicated by March 31, citing successful security operations, infrastructure development, and a strong surrender policy.  Reviewing anti-Naxal efforts in Raipur, Shah highlighted significant gains, including over 500 Naxalites killed and thousands arrested or surrendered in Chhattisgarh since January 2024, weakening the insurgency.

title: 'Still 1.25 crore Hindus in Bangladesh': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat issues unity call
content: ‚ÄãBhagwat also spoke about the deepening concerns over the illegal infiltration in the country, which has continued unabated over the decades, saying: "We should inform the police that we suspect these people are foreigners, and they should investigate and keep an eye on them, and we will also keep an eye on them. We will not give employment to any foreigner."

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: Drake places $1m bet on Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX vs Seahawks
content: Drake has put a big bet on the New England Patriots to win Super Bowl LX. The Patriots, led by coach Mike Vrabel and quarterback Drake Maye, surprised many people with their turnaround season. They will take on the Seattle Seahawks, led by quarterback Sam Darnold. The championship game will be played on February 8, 2026.

title: 'EC should hoist BJP's flag': Akhilesh slams poll body over Form 7 'misuse'
content: ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãAlleging a coalition between the BJP and the poll body, the former Uttar Pradesh CM said that Form 7 was being completed and printed at the locations where the Samajwadi Party had won, and "disturbances have occurred at many of them." The SP chief further alleged that BJP won the ‚Äã‚ÄãBihar election through use of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and is "trying" the same in poll-bound West Bengal.

title: How Trump may has made two of the world's richest men change their Big plans for ....
content: SpaceX has postponed its Mars mission to March 2027, now targeting a lunar landing for NASA's Artemis program. This shift, influenced by US officials, aligns with Elon Musk's vision of the Moon as a stepping stone for space-based AI and future Mars colonization.

title: When will U19 WC winner Vaibhav Sooryavanshi turn 15?
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, born on March 27, 2011, will turn 15 on March 27, 2026. Despite his record-breaking performances in U19 and domestic cricket, he cannot play senior international cricket yet due to the ICC‚Äôs minimum age rule of 15. He is also ineligible for future U19 World Cups due to BCCI rules. Once he turns 15, he will be eligible for India‚Äôs senior team, with huge expectations around him.

title: Kerala: Forest officials bust gang trying to sell tiger skin, claws, teeth; 7 held
content: Forest officials in Kerala's Kannur district arrested a seven-member gang and seized tiger skin, claws, and teeth. Acting on intelligence, the operation led to the recovery of the body parts from three suspects, with four more apprehended later. The investigation suggests a possible link to poachers in Karnataka.

title: Epstein wanted to impregnate 20 women at once to create 'super race' using his DNA
content: Financier Jeffrey Epstein harbored plans for a genetically engineered 'super-race'. He discussed these transhumanist ideas with scientists and business figures. Epstein envisioned using his Zorro Ranch in New Mexico for his ambitious genetic experiments. These discussions reportedly began in the early 2000s. The New York Times reported little evidence of the scheme progressing beyond fantasy.

title: U19 World Cup 2026 team of the tournament revealed ‚Äì see who made it!
content: The ICC has announced its Under-19 Men's Cricket World Cup 2026 Team of the Tournament, featuring three players from champions India, including Player of the Tournament Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Runners-up England also secured three spots, with Thomas Rew named captain. The squad highlights outstanding individual performances from across the globe.

title: 'A call to genocide': Cong slams BJP over Himanta's 'point-blank' video, seeks action
content: The Congress party has accused the BJP of promoting hate and targeting minorities. This follows a video posted by the BJP's Assam unit showing Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma firing a rifle at two individuals identified as minorities. The Congress has demanded strict judicial action, calling the video a call to genocide.

title: Tim Seifert's fifty drives NZ to five-wicket T20 World Cup win over Afghanistan
content: New Zealand secured a five-wicket victory against Afghanistan in the T20 World Cup. Tim Seifert played a crucial role with a commanding 65 runs. Afghanistan posted 182 for six, with Gulbadin Naib scoring 63. Seifert's innings, supported by Glenn Phillips, ensured New Zealand chased the target with minimal fuss. Daryl Mitchell and Mitchell Santner finished the game.

title: Mohan Bhagwat says RSS asked him to continue after turning 75
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will continue in his role beyond 75 years, as directed by the organization, stating retirement from work is not an option. He emphasized that the RSS chief must be a Hindu, chosen based on merit, not caste. The Sangh focuses on instilling values rather than campaigning, and supports anti-corruption efforts.

title: Kritika Kamra and Gaurav Kapur set to get married in March - reports
content: Love is in the air for Kritika Kamra and Gaurav Kapur, as whispers of their impending nuptials circulate! Scheduled for late March or early April in the bustling heart of Mumbai, the couple made their relationship Instagram official in December 2025 and are now busy planning their joyous celebration. Read on.

title: Maharashtra zilla parishad polls: Video shows minor boy 'casting vote'
content: A viral video from Solapur district, Maharashtra, shows a 14-year-old boy allegedly casting a vote alongside his father, a Zilla Parishad election candidate. The father claimed his son merely wanted to observe the voting process. The incident occurred during Saturday's polls in Akluj.

title: Mikaela Shiffrin net worth timeline: wins, medals, sponsors, and earnings
content: Mikaela Shiffrin's financial journey showcases a remarkable ascent, from a near-$1 million net worth in 2016 to an estimated $10-12 million by 2026. Driven by consistent World Cup victories, Olympic triumphs, and lucrative brand endorsements, her earnings have surged, reflecting her status as a global skiing icon.

title: ‚ÄòGaurav, wife have deep Pak link‚Äô: Himanta steps up attack on Gogoi; Cong MP slams ‚ÄòC-grade‚Äô claims
content: Assam cabinet decided to refer the case of Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi's alleged Pakistan connections to the ministry of home affairs, citing national security concerns. Chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma stated that a Pakistan-based firm employed Gogoi's wife, with salary allegedly paid by a Pakistani national, necessitating central agency intervention.

title: ‚Äò35 minutes of horror‚Äô: Kerala spa gang-rape survivor says knife was held to her neck
content: A Thiruvalla spa survivor detailed a brutal gang rape by 10 individuals, stating she was threatened with a knife and suspected one attacker was drugged. Police are investigating a possible 'quotation' motive, with the spa owner alleging a rival spa owner and a police-gangster alliance are behind the attack.

title: 'Battle Of Galwan': Salman Khan starrer to be postponed; makers to seek MoD clearance
content: Salman Khan's upcoming war drama, 'Battle Of Galwan', faces a potential delay from its April 17, 2026 release. Reshoots are ongoing, and the filmmakers must secure clearance from the Ministry of Defence, making the original deadline unlikely. The team prioritizes accuracy for the film depicting the 2020 Galwan Valley clash.

title: China carried out covert nuclear test days after Galwan clash in June 2020: US
content: The US has accused China of a covert nuclear test on June 22, 2020, shortly after the deadly Galwan Valley clash. This allegation, coupled with the expiry of the New START treaty, highlights the urgent need for a new global arms control framework.

title: Bengaluru gym trainer dies by suicide after lover‚Äôs engagement
content: A 26-year-old gym trainer died by suicide after learning his girlfriend of three years was engaged to another man. He reportedly left a note blaming his lover and her mother for his death. Family members stated he was devastated by the news and had financially supported his girlfriend.

title: French duo reach Shanghai after 518-day walk across 16 countries
content: Two French adventurers, Loic Voisot and Benjamin Humblot, have completed an extraordinary 16-country trek from France to Shanghai, walking nearly 12,850 kilometers over 518 days. Driven by environmental concerns and a desire for adventure, they overcame harsh winters and desert crossings to achieve their goal. The duo celebrated their arrival on the Bund, reflecting on their year-and-a-half-long journey.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan seeks dialogue with ICC over boycott call
content: The ICC and PCB have resumed discussions regarding Pakistan's potential boycott of their T20 World Cup match against India. The PCB invoked 'force majeure' after the Pakistan government instructed them not to play, citing solidarity with Bangladesh. The ICC has warned of significant financial repercussions for the PCB if the boycott proceeds.

title: Consenting adults entitled to live together without fear: Delhi HC
content: The order of 05.08.2025 by Justice Sanjeev Narula stated that family disapproval could not be used to curtail the autonomy, dignity, and personal freedom of two adults who are legally married to each other of their own free will.

title: Video: Moment ‚Äòtsunami ride‚Äô collapsed at Surajkund Mela; cop dead, 13 injured
content: A police inspector died and 13 were injured when an electrical swing collapsed at the Surajkund International Crafts Fair. The ride, carrying 26 people, came unhinged mid-operation. A stall owner rescued several riders before the swing fully collapsed, trapping the inspector. Investigations into mechanical or electrical failure are underway.

title: Ex-owner of Multani Bakery jumps from 17th floor, dies
content: Former owner of Solapur's renowned Multani Bakery, Sunil Motilal Sadarangani, died by suicide by jumping from a 17th-floor apartment building. Police suspect psychological issues and debt contributed to his actions. Sadarangani had sold his bakery and relocated to Pune, with his family confirming his struggles.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Kucherov gaining on MacKinnon for MVP?
content: it's not that Miller won the Vezina Trophy in the same season he backstopped Team USA to an overtime loss in the gold medal round at the Vancouver Games . a great goal from Nathan MacKinnon puts the Avalanche up 2-0 over the Red Wings .

title: No Spanish? No problem: Bad Bunny promises a party at halftime
content: Bad Bunny reassures fans they don't have to speak his native language to enjoy the show . "people only have to worry about dance. it's better if they learn to dance," the 31-year-old says . he was greeted by a chorus of fans yelling, "Benito," as he arrived for the pre-Super Bowl event .

title: Super Bowl commercials that feature athletes: Serena, Peyton and Hall of Fame tight ends
content: the ads feature athletes during super Bowl LX between the new England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks . the ads are often priceless, but the right ad can be priceless . there's often a hefty price attached to commercials, and this year is no different .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll heading into Olympic break
content: snubs, injuries and countries not participating bolster debate about the tournament . the theme of this week's Power Rankings is who is the "top" player from each NHL team that isn't on an Olympic roster going to Milan . it's quite possible that Nichushkin would have also been boarding a plane overseas .

title: Why Barcelona's Super League withdrawal ends uneasy truce with Real Madrid
content: laLiga giants Barcelona and real madrid were the last ones still clinging to the vain hope of getting a lucrative new competition off the ground . on saturday, bar√ßa officially confirmed once and for all that they were ending their involvement in the moribund project .

title: Super Bowl LX betting buzz: Big bets continue to roll in on Seahawks
content: our super bowl betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at the sports betting stories that are driving the conversation leading up to the big game . the bulk of the action continues to be on the Seattle Seahawks . sportsbooks director and sportsbook director Tom Gable explains why he's siding with the seahawks over the Patriots in the super bowl .

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?
content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: 'Still a chance': Lindsey Vonn is ready for the 2026 Olympics
content: skier LINDSEY VONN pushed out of a start gate for the first time this year . the 10th skier to drop skied smoothly and confidently and led through most of the course . three days earlier, she announced that she would still compete at these Olympics . coach: "this felt like race day to me"

title: Road to Super Bowl LX: Bad Bunny's music is a soundtrack for each NFL playoff team
content: a rematch of super Bowl XLIX will take place this year between the Seattle Seahawks and the new England Patriots . the most streamed artist in the world in 2025 and the Grammy Award-winner for Album of the Year, Bad Bunny, will take center stage .

title: ‚ÄòHeadlight was still on‚Äô: How a pit dug hours before tragedy became death trap for Delhi biker
content: A 25-year-old biker tragically died after plunging into a 14-foot-deep pit in Janakpuri, Delhi. Despite being alerted, the sub-contractor who excavated the site allegedly walked away without calling for help. The victim remained undiscovered for over six hours before police were finally notified.

title: Ofcom revokes TV licences of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) president
content: UK's Ofcom has revoked broadcasting licences for MATV National and MATV Music, held by Middlesex Broadcasting Corporation Limited. The regulator determined that MATV Broadcasting Ltd, where Kuldeep Shekhawat is a director, exercised editorial control, not the licence holder. Ofcom cited Shekhawat's role as president of Overseas Friends of BJP (UK) as a potential disqualification due to political affiliations.

title: When three words can shatter a life: How triple talaq robs women of their 'haq'
content: triple talaq is a brutal power play that shatters lives in seconds . a husband utters three words, and a woman loses her home, income, and future . women bear the full blow when a marriage ends impulsively . "justification" becomes code for suffering silently to avoid scandal .
